snippet: Texas’s new voter ID law will be tested again in the March 4 primary, with Democrats predicting a day of confusion and Republicans saying such concerns are overblown.
abstract: Texas is preparing for the first major test of its hotly debated new voter ID law as Democrats and Republicans offer sharply differing assessments of its impact on the state’s March primary; Democrats say the law is already resulting in widespread confusion that could lead to delays at voting booths; Republicans say fears of disruptions are being overstated.
lead_paragraph: Texas’s new voter ID law will be tested again in the March 4 primary, with Democrats predicting a day of confusion and Republicans saying such concerns are overblown.

headline.main: Party Predictions Differ in Texas on Impact of New Voter ID Law
headline.print_headline: Party Predictions Differ in Texas on Impact of New Voter ID Law
